definition: Explaining in words is not as good as teaching by example (idiom). Action speaks louder than words.
pinyin: yan2 jiao4 bu4 ru2 shen1 jiao4

definition: body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
teaching by example beats explaining in words (idiom)/action speaks louder than words
pinyin: shen1 jiao4 sheng4 yu2 yan2 jiao4

definition: to teach by words and example (idiom)
to set an example (idiom); to serve as a model
those who handle cinnabar are stained red; those who work with ink are stained black (idiom)/you are the product of your environment
pinyin: jin4 zhu1 zhe3 chi4 , jin4 mo4 zhe3 hei1

definition: subordinates follow the example of their superiors (idiom)
of all virtues filial piety is most important (idiom)

pinyin: you3 qi2 fu4 bi4 you3 qi2 zi3

definition: What you don't want done to you, don't do to others. (idiom, from the Confucian analects)/Do as you would be done by./Do not do to others what you would not have them do to you.
pinyin: ji3 suo3 bu4 yu4 , wu4 shi1 yu2 ren2

definition: (idiom) one's actions are in keeping with what one says
see a worthy, think to imitate (idiom, from Analects); emulate the virtuous/Follow the example of a virtuous and wise teacher.
To learn without thinking is confusing, to think without learning is dangerous (Confucius)
pinyin: xue2 er2 bu4 si1 ze2 wang3 , si1 er2 bu4 xue2 ze2 dai4
related.word: 學而不思則罔，思而不學則殆
